steps.comment: Mask to the core type (should already be the case)
Enrich node
Map node by reference
Select existing node
steps.label: node/id != null

steps.comment: Map an id
Set created, modified, version, enabled. Set path to the id, we'll recalculate it later
Set to 0
steps.label: node/priority = null

steps.comment: Defaults to false
steps.label: node/anonymized == null

steps.comment: If we have an existing node, it must be of type $staged, if so we update it
steps.label: existingNode

steps.comment: Get the used component type

steps.description: ="The existing node " + node/id + " is a not a staged node, can not update it"
steps.label: existingComponent/name != "$staged"
steps.message: The existing node is a not a staged node, can not update it

steps.comment: Map most of the new fields into the existing node
Map the fields back into the original instance
You probably hid the component id when creating, we derive it from the type
steps.label: node/componentId == null
null
steps.message: No component id configured and no type id was passed in

steps.label: componentName == null
steps.message: No component id configured and no collection name could be detected

steps.comment: Get the context information for the core type. This means the package containing the defining type is the context.
We only want it for higher level packages. This also means it won't be recursive on node itself which is in a utility package.
steps.label: contextInformation/projectType == "application" || contextInformation/projectType == "business"

steps.comment: If its a new node and we have no parent and we don't specifically disable it, let's add a context parent
steps.label: !existingNode && node/parentId == null && node/componentId != null && configuration/allowEmptyParentId != true

steps.comment: Get the context information for the core type. This means the package containing the defining type is the context.
steps.label: !contextInformation

steps.comment: Already resolved in the above, don't resolve again
steps.label: businessPackageContext != null

steps.comment: We only want it for higher level packages. This also means it won't be recursive on node itself which is in a utility package.
steps.label: contextInformation/projectType == "application" || contextInformation/projectType == "business"

steps.comment: We check the component, if it is a global level component (without owner), we assume a root level node is being created (e.g. project). Otherwise we assume you want the $global as parent
Get the used component type if not resolved yet
steps.label: !existingComponent

steps.comment: Recalculate path if necessary
steps.label: node/parentId != null

steps.comment: Select parent node

steps.description: ="Could not find parent " + node/parentId + " when creating node: " + node/name
steps.label: !parentNode

steps.comment: Update the path
TODO: once the token has an ID field, use that (if filled in)
steps.label: node/ownerId = null

steps.comment: Get the current token
If we have a token, check to find the actual user behind it
steps.label: token

steps.comment: Merge the changes
